events.name: GDG Cloud Kick-off: unleash security & storage
events.description:
----TICKET SALES THROUGH EVENTBRITE -----

GDG Netherlands proudly present this event on:
GCP Security, Maintenance & Storage!
A new year and time for a great new announcement: Today we introduce a new subchapter for the GDGs globally and we have a worldwide premiere: 

Google Developers Group Cloud 

The GDG Cloud is focused on the technologies provided by the Google Cloud Platform. There are plently of ideas for sessions and we want to hear from you! GDG Cloud Kick-off: unleash security & storage 

During this event we will have two GDG Experts for Google Cloud Platform who are going to talk about:
Security & Maintenance
Storage 

Join us for our first session at Google Amsterdam. It will be the kick off of the GDG Cloud Worldwide!
There will also be room for lightning talks, so if you have something to share on Google Cloud Platform, this is your platform to do so. 

Speakers & Agenda

events.name: IoT Technology - introducing Brillo & Weave
events.description:
Abstract

GDG Cloud: Introducing Brillo and Weave

In the early '80s the home entertainment industry rivalled over the Laserdisc and the VHS. For those in the industry the answer was easy, the Laserdisc was far superior over the VHS tapes. Looking back on history however, it is clear that the VHS served customers so much better simply because it fitted what people needed at the time.

Today, at the dawn of a ubiquitous world, we can see a similar rivalry in the field of connected devices. Both collectives and organisations are trying to figure out how they can get a piece of the pie. Should it be a custom proprietary communications platform, a custom cloud solution? Or should it be an open source alternative that one could adopt and contribute too?

The Weave protocol is a solution following the latter form. Originated in the NEST labs and now adopted by Google, Weave, on top of Brillo or stand alone, is a completely open communications protocol that one can use to connect devices in a smart and handy way. Because of choices such as XMPP and mDNS, which clearly point out well thought through User Experience Design, Google offers a full end-to-end answer to this question. Because of these clever decisions it also opens the door for new business models for individuals, collectives and enterprises.

In this talk I want to share my thoughts on why I think that Weave might be the solution to this major question everybody in the business of ubiquitous faces. I want to show how it works, why it works and how Google seems to follow their own model of supporting a platform so well, that people want to sign up for their free cloud based solution and share their data without introducing any proprietary obstacles.

Setup

During this event we will have:

• Introduction on Brillo and WeaveLightning talks

• Join us for our session at a special location: Skylounge Amsterdam!

Speakers & Agenda

17:30: Doors open

18:00: Introduction to Brillo and Weave

19:00: Break

19:15: Lighting Talks/Feel free to share your experiences

20:00: wrap-up, socialize

Prerequisite

Whether you are using GCP/Brillo/Weave, or aren’t using familiar with GCP/Brillo/Weave: we encourage every development enthusiast to join and make this event memorable!

Location

Skylounge Amsterdam, Doubletree by Hilton: Oosterdoksstraat 4, 1011 DK, AmsterdamNote: Since it's in the city center it is advised to take public transportation, see here for more information on the location

Foody stuff

Recommend you grab a bite to eat on the way, we'll have snacks and beer but not a full dinner.

Hope to hear and see you at this event. Register here!

events.name: Google Does Machine Learning
events.description:
Brought to you by Google Cloud Platform for Startups and GDG-Cloud

Please join Google’s product lead for Cloud Intelligence in a discussion of machine learning and predictive analytics. Rob will discuss how you can leverage the power of ML whether you have a machine learning team of your own or if you just want to use ML as a service. Google has invested deeply in machine learning for many years and is using it successfully across its highly successful consumer businesses. Google Cloud Platform is using the power of that work, adding in powerful data management tools, support for collaborative experiments, and predictions at Google scale.

Agenda

• 18:00 Doors open, welcome, drinks

• 18:30 - 19:45: Talk by Rob, Q&A

• 19:45 - 20:30: Drinks, networking, discussion, potential lightning talks

Rob Craft is the lead Product Manager for the Cloud Intelligence team in Google Cloud Platform. He is responsible for Cloud Machine Learning, Cloud Search, Internet of Things, and Cloud Pub/Sub. Rob has spent many years focused on building great products on the leading edge of what's next. This time spans early days working on OS kernels and .Net, High Performance Computing, and transforming the cloud with machine learning. Rob lives in San Francisco, CA.

events.name: GDG Cloud: Customer Success Stories in GCP!
events.description:
Abstract
The GDG Cloud is focussed on the technologies provided by the Google Cloud Platform. This time, the GDG Cloud gives you the opportunity to hear first-hand success stories from others!

Next to that we have Mark Westerhof (ANP, the Dutch Press Bureau) who will talk about Digital News Initiative and his experiences with Google Cloud Platform. He will share his vision on GCP and ANP. After studying (Bachelor of ICT) Mark was a partner in 1996 in an IT startup that quickly developed into a content hub for publishers who thus could sell and distribute their content in the B2B market. This company was acquired in 2004 by the ANP. Mark is currently CTO and Operations Manager at the ANP. 

We also have another GCP Customer, Jordy Cuiper from Fanly who will share his story too. Jord Cuiper is a 27 year old entrepreneur and founder of Fanly. Fanly is a cloud-based loyalty platform for (SME+) retailers which enables them to build strong customer relationships and increase revenues. Fanly looks back on a very successful first year ('15) with over 350 participating retailers, 900% growth in sales, many successcases and a strong & fun team. Jord’s ambition is to grow Fanly (and the team) to one of the leading players in offering cloud based loyalty solutions (Saas) to medium-sized retailers, POS providers and other retail related third parties in Europe. And.. have lots of fun along the way. Most important to Jord is to be in control of his own path, failures and successes. In addition to that his family, friends and the people he works with on a day to day basis mean the world to him. He considers himself a very lucky guy because of the fact that these people are the most inspiring, talented and fun people! There will be room to share your experiences, so if you have something to share on GCP, this is your platform to do so!

Speakers & Agenda
18:00: Opening doors
18:15: Digital News Initiative by Mark Westerhoff (ANP)
19:15: GCP Success Stories by Jord Cuiper (Fanly)
19:45: Lightning Talks
20:00: Wrap up & Beers!

Prerequisite
Whether you are using GCP, or aren’t using familiar with GCP: we encourage every cloud development enthusiast to join and make this event memorable!

Foody stuff
Recommend you grab a bite to eat on the way, we'll have snacks and beer but not a full dinner.

events.name: GDG Cloud: Microservices
events.description:
GDG Netherlands proudly presents this event onMicroservices

Microservices describe a particular way of designing software applications as suites of independently deployable services. During this event you’ll hear from an expert in the field; Jean-Baptiste Clion! Jean-Baptiste (a.k.a JB) is a GDE and senior cloud engineer working with Google Technologies since 2007. He is the founder and co-organiser of GDG Basel, Switzerland. Jean-Baptiste worked in various industries such as Defence & Aeronautics and Finance & Consulting. In his last position, JB was Google Practice Lead at Capgemini Switzerland, he is now co-founding a startup dedicated to Progressive Web Apps solutions relying on cloud technologies. During his talk JB will also cover some cool stuff about a major open source API manager

Besides learning the “all you need to knows” about the particular way of designing software applications as suites of independently deployable services, you’ll attend a codelab led by Martin Berends. Martin is a Google Developer Expert for Cloud Platform since 2014. He has worked as a freelance software development consultant and trainer for about 30 years specializing in data communications and industrial automation. He teaches computer programming, has experience in Open Source language projects and delivers presentations at community events. Martin contributes practitioner and design skills to several small startup businesses.

You don’t want to miss this event at Xebia in vibrant Amsterdam! Register here! 


Speakers & Agenda

• 17:45: Doors open, snacks & beer

• 18:30: Microservices by Jean-Baptiste Clion

• 19:30: Break19:45: Codelab by Martin Berends

• 20:30: Spark talks, beers & socialize - Feel free to share your experiences!

• 21:00: Wrap-up

Audience

We encourage every GCP enthusiast to join and make this event memorable!

Foody stuff

We’ll have dinner at the event so arrive hungry!

Hope to hear and see you at this event,

GDG Cloud Organizers & Xebia

Constantijn, Matthew, Rokesh, Stefan, Christaan, Tal and Margot

events.name: GDG Cloud: Building Node.js apps with Mete Atamel
events.description:
About

Node.js makes building web applications that perform at scale easy - and Google App Engine makes running Node.js in production fun. Mete Atamel will join us on this event to talk about the various ways one can run Node.js applications on Google Cloud Platform. And we’ll let you do it yourself too! Mete will walk you through deploying your first Hello World app and using the gcloud NPM module. We’ll also connect our app to other Google Cloud services like the Vision API (to classify images), Cloud Storage (for binary storage) and Pub/Sub (for messaging). Other subjects include versioning, traffic splitting, live debugging, HTTP tracing and all the other features that make running Node.js in the cloud fun!

About Mete

Mete Atamel is a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud Platform. As a long-time Java and a recent C# developer, he likes to compare the two ecosystems. Before Google he worked at Microsoft, Skype, Adobe, EMC, and Nokia; building apps and services on various web, mobile and cloud platforms. Originally from Cyprus, he currently lives not too far from the prime meridian in Greenwich.

Tickets

Sign up on Eventbrite! Just RVSP'ing on Meetup is not enough.

Agenda

17:00: Doors open

17:45: Building Node.js Apps on GCP -Mete Atamel, Developer Advocate @Google

18:45: Break

19:15: Node.js on Google Cloud codelab

20:00: Wrap-up, drinks & socializing

Audience

Whether you are using Node.js on GCP, or aren’t but need to be inspired: we encourage every GCP enthusiast to join and make this event memorable!

Foody stuff

We’ll have snacks and drinks (but not a full dinner so we recommend you grab a bite to eat on the way just in case).

Hope to hear and see you at this event,

GDG Cloud Organizers

Matthew, Rokesh, Clara, Christiaan and Tal

events.name: Martin Gorner is here: Massive-scale data processing with Google Cloud Dataflow
events.description:
How can you handle the data coming from a fleet of NYC taxis reporting their location in real time ? And how can you focus on the processing, not on deploying and babysitting servers ? How can you compute accurate business data for reporting as well as fast estimates for your real-time dashboard with the same code and infrastructure?

Data processing technologies have evolved significantly in the past 10 years, from MapReduce (2004!) to the real-time low-latency parallel data stream processing tools of today. In this lab you will write a data pipeline using the "Dataflow model" embraced by both Google Cloud Dataflow for a no-ops cloud deployment or Apache Beam for on-premise execution. You will test it on a really big data stream and see it autoscale to tens of nodes to process the load.

This lab uses real NYC taxi data to simulate a real-time stream of taxis reporting their position and status. With the help of Cloud Dataflow you will be able to aggregate the massive amount of incoming data and display it on a visually engaging dasboard map.

events.name: "So how does Tensorflow work?", guest star Siraj Raval
events.description:
Are you ready to learn more about how Tensorflow works and get inspired to take it for a spin? Come for a fun, inspirational, cool talk - accessible for all ranges of expertise.

Talk 1: Siraj Raval, "So how does Tensorflow work?"

Siraj Raval will give a broad overview of some of the key features of Tensorflow and show off an example in Python.

Siraj is a Data Scientist, Youtube Star, and Best Selling Author of Decentralized Applications. He recently finished teaching the Deep Learning Nanodegree at Udacity and is currently teaching a course called The Math of Intelligence on Youtube. 

Talk 2: Matthias Feys, "Machine Learning at Scale with Google Cloud Platform"

Doing Machine Learning typically involves big datasets and lots of model iterations. During this talk Matthias will show how to use Google Cloud to speed up that process and actually run your Tensorflow at scale.

Matthias is a data geek, passionate about gaining insights from data. By day, at Datatonic/ML6*, he helps corporations unleashing the power of data using Google Cloud Platform with custom Machine Learning solutions. By night, Matthias is GDE for ML and GCP, and loves sharing his knowledge at technical events.

Lightning Talks (sign up when you arrive!)

Timeline

17:30 - Doors open. Pizza & Drinks, socializing

18:00 - Siraj, "So How Does Tensorflow Work"

19:15 - Socializing, then Lightning Talks

20:00 - Matthias, "Machine Learning at Scale"

21:00 - Closing time!

events.name: Spanner, or "Let's Try & Break the CAP Theorem", starring Reza,Sami and Deepti
events.description:
Spanner: Globally replicated, strongly consistent, relational database. Such a thing only exists inside Google!

Reza Rokni, "Spanner: Let's Try and  Break the CAP Theorem!"

Reza Rokni and Sami Zuhuruddin are Cloud Platform Solution Architects, and Google's experts on Spanner. They'll give a talk about how Spanner works under the covers, how you use it in your applications, and the kind of things you can accomplish

Special moment: The Product Manager Cloud Spanner Deepti Srivastava will be joining live from Mountain View to talk about the Future of Spanner.

Brainstorming: We've limited our ideas of what we can do with global applications based on the CAP theorem's challenges around data. What can we do, now that we can break (okay Bend) the CAP theorem?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=amcf6W2Xv6M

Beers & Pizza: Sponsored by our friends at Rockstars IT!

Timeline

18:00 - Doors open. Pizza & Drinks, socializing

18:45 - Reza Rokni & Sami, "Spanner - let's try and break the CAP Theorem!"

19:45 - Socializing, then structured brainstorming

20:00- Live Hangout with Deepti Srivastava on the Future of Spanner

21:00 - Closing time!
events.how_to_find_us: It's on central station Amsterdam. Easy to reach!

events.name: Google Cloud for Data Scientists and Data Engineers
events.description:
GoDataDriven, Binx and GDG Cloud proudly present the "Google Cloud for Data Scientists and Data Engineers" meetup.

In this session, we are going to explore  Data Science best practices with Google Cloud. This meetup is part of GoDataFest, the five-day festival of data technology that takes place from October 16-20. Before this Meetup, during the day, you have the opportunity to attend an in-depth Machine Learning Bootcamp with Carl Osipov as well. More information: www.godatafest.com/google

Speakers

Machine Learning Specialist Erwin Huizenga (Google) and Data Engineer Constantijn Visinescu (Binx.io) will be the speakers of this session.

Background

Google has been doing data science even way before it became popular. Google has provided a couple of their tools to the public in Google Cloud. Since Erwin in his previous role was a data scientist, he's going to share his experiences on performing data science on Google Cloud. The Data Engineering part(on Hadoop and Spark) will be introduced by Constantijn . The goal is to provide you insights in how fast, easy, and advanced the available solutions are. 

Binx, as part of Xebia Group, is helping organizations to move, innovate, and run in the cloud.

If you are data scientist or data engineer or just interested, don't miss out on this event!

Foody stuff

Pizza’s, snacks, and drinks are provided by GoDataDriven and Binx.

events.name: Zero to ML with Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
• Important to know
Sign up on eventbrite! https://zerotoml.eventbrite.co.uk

• What we'll do
GDG Cloud and Rockstars IT proudly welcome Sara Robinson in the Netherlands with her talk on Zero to ML on GCP

Everyone’s talking about machine learning, but we hear much less about how to put it into practice. And let’s face it, that can be daunting! Even just 10 years ago you needed access to extensive academic and computing resources to make use of machine learning. Fast forward to today and we’ve seen revolutionary changes in the hardware and software that are making ML accessible for any developer or data scientist.

Sara will start with the basics: how to use a pre-trained ML model with one REST API call. Then you’ll learn how to use your own dataset to customize a pre-trained model with transfer learning. We’ll end by learning how to build your own model from scratch with TensorFlow, and how train and serve it in the cloud with GCP. We’ll end with some codelabs!

*Agenda*
17:30: Doors open
18:00: Zero to ML on GCP by Sara Robinson
18:45: Break
19:00: Code Labs
20:30 Wrap-up

*Audience*
Whether you’re completely new to ML or you’ve already trained and deployed your own model from scratch, Google Cloud Platform has a variety of tools to help you start using ML right now and Sara will show you them!

*Foody stuff*
We’ll have snacks and drinks (but not a full dinner so we recommend you grab a bite to eat on the way just in case).

Hope to hear and see you at this event,

GDG Cloud Organizers

Rokesh, Tea, Matthew and Clara

Disclaimer: GDG Netherlands is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on this site should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

• Important to know
Sign up on eventbrite! https://zerotoml.eventbrite.co.uk

events.name: CI/CD + CB + K8S : Say what ? Automation in Google Cloud in action!
events.description:
• What we'll do
Kramp Hub is building a new B2B platform for Kramp and other tenants. It is developed in-house using cloud technologies as Google Cloud and Kubernetes to build a microservices based architecture in an agile way of working.

For obvious reasons, we invested in setting up a continuous build, integration and deployment environment. In the past year, we have tried, enjoyed and loathed several approaches (think Jenkins, Makefile, Concourse, Bitbucket Pipelines, DIY and GCB).

Using at least 3 talks, we would like share what we have learned, what workflow we agreed upon and what tooling we currently use to support this way of working. We will include demo's for the interesting parts from our actual setup.

• What to bring
A smile :)

• Important to know
It's in Jaarbeursplein 6, and on the 6th floor, you'll have to go through a startup area totally to the end: That's where Kramp Tech Hub is.
events.how_to_find_us: It's in Jaarbeursplein 6, and on the 6th floor, you'll have to go through a startup area totally to the end: That's where Kramp Tech Hub is.

events.name: Dive into Machine Learning with Google Cloud - workshop (b.y.o.d)
events.description:
"Dive into Machine Learning with Google Cloud" (Bring your own device workshop)

Are you passionate about Machine Learning but want to dive deeper into it? Are you interested to try Machine Learning in an interactive environment? On April 13th (Friday) Jannes and Kaitao will take you on a 3-hour journey of Computer Vision and Reinforcement Learning through Google Colaboratory environment.

Please note: This is an intermediate event, so the knowledge of Python* and familiarity with basic data science tools and techniques* are needed to follow the workshop.

Jannes Klaas - Computer Vision overview:

"The workshop is showing a modern computer vision pipeline from preprocessing to pre-trained models to custom model heads, using Tensorflow, Keras and OpenCV. It gives practical tricks on how to organize the workflow and shows off some useful and less known libraries. Participants should be comfortable with Python and basic data science tools like pandas and numpy. A certain familiarity with google cloud platform helps for participants who want to replicate or modify the workshop content at home "

Kaitao Yang - Reinforcement Learning (RL):

"Reinforcement Learning (RL) is believed to be a general approach towards Artificial Intelligence (AI). RL is the foundation for many recent AI applications, eg, Automated Driving, Automated Trading, Robotics, Gaming, Dynamic Decision, and many more. With concrete examples, this workshop introduces the basic elements of RL, eg, Agent, Environment, State, State Transition, Policy, Action, Reward, Future Return, Discounted Future Return, Exploration & Exploitation, Markov Decision Processing, The Bellman Equation, Policy -based Learning, Value-based Learning, etc. "

17:30 - Doors open
18:00 - Computer Vision workshop (Jannes)
19:15 - break (food and drinks provided by Binx.io and GoDataDriven)
19:45 - Reinforcement Learning workshop (Kaitao)
21:00 - end of event

Binx.io & GoDataDriven sponsor location, drinks and food.

Please note: as the space is limited to 30 people, please change you attendance if you will not attend so other people can register!

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 at Google Amsterdam (Registration through EventBrite!)
events.description:
• Important to know
REGISTRATION ONLY THROUGH EVENT BRITE LINK!! NO TICKET IS NO ACCESS

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/google-io-extended-2018-google-amsterdam-tickets-44222727368

• What we'll do
It's that time of the year: Google I/O 2018 is here and if you didn't manage to get a ticket, this is your chance to be part of this event by attending a Google I/O Extended, where we will watch the Keynote together and afterwards socialize, have drinks and share what you've learned from the Keynote.

• What to bring
Just a big smile!

events.name: Google Assistant is hot. In this workshop you will build your own assistant!
events.description:
Google I/O 2018 Keynote showed that the Google Assistant is quite central in many Google products and there is more to come.

If you want to know how you could build your own assistant, then you are welcome to join this hands-on workshop. We are pleased to announce that the sponsor and host is Accenture.

Agenda
17:30 - Doors open: Walk-in & dinner
18:30 - Introduction to the Google Assistant
19:15 - Hands-on lab
20:30 - Wrap-up

Audience
Whether you’re completely new to chatbots or you’ve already created one once, we'll invite you to join and create your own chatbot during the session.

Prerequisites
Please register for a GCP account upfront in order to be able to follow the codelab instructions: https://console.cloud.google.com/getting-started

How to get there?
Accenture is located in the ITO toren in Zuidas. Please find the reception on the 17th floor, where you can pick up your visitor's badge.

About Accenture
Accenture Digital Applied Intelligence is intelligent technology and human ingenuity applied at the core of business – across every function and process – to address our clients' most complex challenges. We combine Artificial Intelligence with deep industry and analytics expertise to help our clients embrace intelligent technologies confidently and responsibly.

Hope to hear and see you at this event!
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the 17th Floor in the ITO building

events.name: Machine Learning in Practice
events.description:
June 7th we're heading to the RDM in Rotterdam for some interesting talks on what people are doing in practice with Machine Learning

Schedule:
18:00 - Doors open & food
18:30 - Automatic Detection of Zebra Crossings in Aerial Imagery
19:00 - Break
19:15 - Deep Reinforcement Learning with Unity 3D
20:00 - Networking
21:00 - End of event

Directions:

Getting to RDM is a little tricky by public transport, so if going by car is an option for you, I'd definitely do it. The advantage of going with public transport is the free Watertaxi ride at the end of the event. (More info below)

By car : This one's easy. There is plenty of free parking space nearby, from the highway follow the signs Heijplaat / RDM

By public transport : From Rotterdam Centraal, it's easiest to rent an OV fiets and ride to Jobshaven, where there is a Waterbus leaving. Taking the tram to the Waterbus is also possible, but you'd likely miss the connection. The Waterbus only leaves every 30 min. You can take your bike on the Waterbus, but if you plan on taking the Watertaxi back with us, please leave your bike at Jobshaven as you are not allowed to take it with you on the Watertaxi!

Return trip : The last Waterbus back to Jobshaven departs at 20:20. So we have arranged (free!) Watertaxi's leaving at around the end of the event. Watertaxi's are really fast and very cool, so I can definitely recommend it!

Once you're at RDM, please follow these directions to get into the building:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=14M-xcPwYqZtb0CzUE2Hp9LKZN5e-CL15

I will make sure to have you guided from there!

Captain AI and https://www.meetup.com/RDMTech/ are sponsoring location, drinks and food.

• GeoAI: Automatic Detection of Zebra Crossings in Aerial Imagery by Maartje Holtslag & Niels van der Vaart (Esri Nederland)

Zebra crossings are an important feature on Dutch streets, as they give pedestrians the opportunity to safely cross roads. However, in the Netherlands the exact locations of zebra crossings are not known. In this project I created a method to automatically detect zebra crossings in aerial imagery, by using the TensorFlow Object Detection API to create a neural network model. The Scikit-Optimize library was used to optimize the hyper-parameters of this model. The final model was implemented into ArcGIS Pro to be able to detect zebra crossings in aerial imagery in a live environment.

Machine learning can be applied in many different fields. One of the relatively new fields in which machine learning is currently explored is the Geographic Information Systems (GIS) field. Spatial data cannot only be used to visualize results, but interesting analysis can be performed using this information. During this presentation an overview will be given of the possibilities when combining machine learning with GIS. A demonstration will show how an object detection framework is used to detect zebra crossings in aerial imagery.

• Deep Reinforcement Learning with Unity 3D by Gerard Simons (Captain AI)

Deep Reinforcement Learning (RL) is a very exciting relatively new field of machine learning, that has gained much notoriety thanks to the recent achievements of Deep Mind's Alpha Go. The idea behind it is to train a deep neural network to exhibit desirable behaviour by interacting with an environment. More specifically, it learns a series of actions, called a policy, that maximises a user-defined reward function given the current state of environment. Unity 3D is a popular game engine that has recently incorporated a new open-source plug-in called ML Agents that allows anyone to develop these RL agents inside a Unity game.

At Captain AI we have experimented with this plug-in to show the potential of RL for solving navigational tasks in a maritime environment. During the presentation we will discuss the theory and principles behind RL, how Unity 3D and the MLAgents plugin works and show you what all this looks like in an autonomous shipping scenario.

events.name: Google Cloud Next - Extended
events.description:
Before we get our Google Cloud NEXT in Amsterdam, the largest gathering of the GCP community starts of its tour in San Francisco with big announcements! GDG Cloud offers you the opportunity to watch the keynote live at Google Amsterdam. There will be plenty of opportunities to discuss all the news afterward, with a certain emphasis on the topics of Machine Learning and Kubernetes. Hope to see you there!

AUDIENCE
Whether you are using Google Cloud, or aren’t using the cloud but want to be inspired; we encourage every GCP enthusiast to join and make this event memorable!

Spots are limited, so please give your spot up if you can't make it.

FOODY STUFF
There will be food ;)

AGENDA
5.30 pm - Food
6.00 pm - Keynote & Discussion
8.00 pm - Drinks

Hope to hear and see you at this event,

GDG Cloud Organizers
Tea, Clara, Rokesh, Constantijn and Matt

events.name: Firebase - Meet the devs!
events.description:
November 1st we're heading to the Google office in Amsterdam for talks about Firebase by two of Google's Software engineers that are working on the product!

Alex Memering - Using Firebase and GCP together
Firebase gives you many tools to help build user facing applications, but sometime you need more control. We'll discuss some easy ways to leverage GCP products from existing Firebase projects. We'll also talk about how to best propagate those changes back to Firebase and your applications.

Arthur Thompson - Cross Platform Messaging with Firebase Cloud Messaging
Different platforms have different messaging requirements even if you want to send them the same message. With FCM HTTP v1 API you can target multiple platforms with a single request and I'll show you how.

Schedule:
18:00 - Doors open & food
18:45 - Alex Memering - Using Firebase and GCP together
19:30 - Arthur Thompson - Cross Platform Messaging with FCM
20:15 - Networking & open discussion
21:00 - End of event

Google's sponsoring the location and food.

events.name: GDG CloudFest Netherlands -> Register at http://gdgcloudfestnl.eventbrite.com
events.description:
**NOTE: Thanks to our sponsors, we've just released a new batch of tickets on the EventBrite signup - if you are on waiting list here, please grab a ticket there: http://gdgcloudfestnl.eventbrite.com***

We're pleased to announce GDG Cloud's biggest gathering yet:
GDG CloudFest Netherlands! It promises to be an amazing day with multiple talks and knowledge sharing, from within and outside of the community. All things Google Cloud will be there, and as we all know that means a lot of things ;)!

GDG CloudFest Netherlands tickets are free as ever (so is the food) and there will be drinks afterward for all your social && networking needs. Speakers and agenda to be announced!

"When developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen"

**F A Q**

WHERE CAN I FIND MORE INFO?
On our website, cloudfest.gdgnl.app!

WHERE CAN I SIGN UP?
On Eventbrite! http://gdgcloudfestnl.eventbrite.com

WHY CAN'T I RVSP?
Because the tickets won't be sold through meetup! Check out gdgcloudfestnl.eventbrite.com

I HAVE A LOT OF QUESTIONS || I'D LIKE TO MAYBE VOLUNTEER
Get in touch with Clara through canelaguil [ ] gmail.com!

events.name: Focus on your code, not infrastructure
events.description:
December 12st we're heading to the Google office in Amsterdam for talks about serverless computing on google cloud.

Martin Omander - Focus on your code, not infrastructure
In this talk, we will follow the story of the fictional startup "In Jest", publishers of an app that tells jokes. At first, the developers at "In Jest" need to get a minimum viable product up and running in an hour. As their business grows they will have to integrate with Google Sheets, databases, analytics systems, marketing systems and so on. We will see the 100 lines of code needed to make this happen, without having to worry the team about servers and data centers.

Dennis Vriend - One app, two clouds, four stacks in an hour.
In this talk we will look at how to implement a simple CRUD rest service in GCP and AWS using four different stacks and discuss the differences and similarities of the solution.

Schedule:
18:00 - Doors open & food
18:30 - Focus on your code, not infrastructure
19:30 - One app, two clouds, four stacks in an hour.
20:30 - Networking & open discussion
21:00 - End of event

Google's sponsoring the location and food.

events.name: Set your servers on Fire(...base)
events.description:
Dear GDG Cloud community,

on February 22nd at Xebia Academy we will take you for a deep dive into some of the many features that Firebase has to offer.

Together with John Gorter, trainer and consultant at Iconica (https://www.iconica.nl/ ) we will look at what Firebase can provide with regards to serversless computing.

Hosting, Authentication, Databases and Functions are easily implemented in your mobile native and Web Apps, and are some of the topics for this evening.

Follow along (BYOD) and learn how to connect your front-ends to these services in this combination of talk and workshop/codelab.

This is a great opportunity to jumpstart your understanding of Firebase. The spaces are very limited so be quick.

IMPORTANT: if you cannot join the event after registering - change your attendance so someone else can take your place. Be considerate :)

See you soon!

Clara, Constantijn, Matt, Rokesh and Tea

events.name: Quantum & the Cloud
events.description:
Quantum is the future, and the cloud plays a very important part in that future! Join us for this meeting on quantum by none other than Andreu Ibàñez, a man who once started his long career as CTO of Commodore Spain and is currently working in different fields of the Google ecosystem, most notably drones and the Internet of Things.

In this talk he'll go over the exciting developments we're about to face, and the role of cloud in our quantum future!

Doors open at 5.30, start at 6pm. There will be drinks and food!

events.name: Building smarter solutions with machine learning, from magic to reality
events.description:
All the way from Google Paris office, GDG Cloud Netherlands brings you one more amazing speaker! Let's dive into ML solutions (it's been a while :) )

“Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.”
— Arthur C Clarke

Well, machine learning can look like magic, but we don't need to be data scientists or ML researchers to develop with ML. So, what about making our solutions smarter without any knowledge in AI? In this session, we’ll see how to transform or extract information from text, image, audio & video with the latest ML APIs, how to train an AutoML custom model, and we’ll be active players of a live demo. Don't put your smartphone on airplane mode!

Bio:
Laurent is a developer passionate about software, hardware, science and anything shaping the future. He works for Google where he ecstatically explores cloud technologies. In a previous life, he pioneered the ebook industry, co-created the first European ebook reader, and co-founded Bookeen. He now enjoys sharing his passion in international conferences. You can find him on twitter at @PicardParis.

Location:
Startup Village at Science Park in Amsterdam - provided by Info Support.

Agenda:

Doors open: 18:00
Dinner: 18:00-18:45
Talk: 18:45-19:45
Q&A: 19:45 ~

group_profile.intro: Kind of rolled into developing and currently exploring this magical and complicated world of code. I liked actual clouds long before I got into Cloud computing.
